places_with_reviews.name: Hazira Park
places_with_reviews.address: Hajira, Subash Park, Batala, Punjab 143505, India

reviews.text: Good place for morning and evening  walk

Unexpected change in the busy city surroundings in the form of a nice refreshing park. This explains why there was so much crowd there when I visited it on a Sunday evening with my family. You could say it's a miniature version of the Lodhi garden in Delhi. It's a protected monument of a Court person of King Akhbar. Cleanliness is a bit on the lower side here, you can see wrappers thrown on the lawns. There is a need to install dustbins in the park and for people to be more sensitive to maintain cleanliness in this nice park.
Nice place for family outings or a quick evening stroll.

Shamsher Khan's Tomb, Batala is a centrally protected monument under Archaeological Survey of India, Tomb is locally famous with a name Hazira Park, is structurally octagonal in shape. Tomb was  built  in Emperor Akbar era. Sham Sher Khan was fauzdar of Manikpur Riyasat. Here is some photographs for your views.
Thank you

Historical Place.

Samsher Khan Makbara is believed to be the tomb of Shamsher Khan, an army commander of Mughal emperor Akbar. The architectural style suggests it might have been built during Akbar's reign.

Overall, Hazira Park is a place for locals to relax and enjoy greenery, while also offering a glimpse into the historical past through the presence of Samsher Khan Makbara.

It had been my favourite place since childhood.
Used to spend good time here during my school amd college days.
Visited this place after almost 2 decades.
It has been restored well by the local authorities.
The gardens have come up Very well

places_with_reviews.name: Maa Kali Dwara Mandir
places_with_reviews.address: inside Chakri Bazaar Road, Achli Gate, Batala, Punjab 143505, India

reviews.text: It's inside Nehru Gate not Achali Gate
Beautiful kali maa temple best temple god fullfill everyone's wish

The most beautiful and peace giving place in Batala is the Kali dwara Temple. This temple is associated with the Goddess Kali who is residing here in the form of of Vaishnavi Kali. The Prasad offered in the temple is pure and totally Satvik. You can visit the temple from morning 4 a.m. to 10 p.m. the temple is is open for all the people irrespective of their religion. You can visit the temple and get the blessings of Mata Kali with whole hearted surrendering. The sacred aarti is performed twice in a day. The local public ok and the main Mahant always present at the time of Aarti. You can experience a great force of love and blissful peace. I will suggest you to visit the temple on Tuesday and Saturday especially because these are the sacred days selected for the Puja.
Religious/fomous temple in batala punjab

Religious place have great recognition. This is best place with great importance  in the Hindus. Everyone who lives in Batala I think visit at least  once in his life. This temple  is centre of religious  belief  of people. Management  of this temple  is very humble  and priest have healing touch. Jai Mata di. Parking is little problem  as car, / bus can not came at this place. Rest if one have sharda ,  people  came here by bare feet and have firm believe  that Mahakali  will full their wished

places_with_reviews.name: Pahari Gate
places_with_reviews.address: R655+P63, Pahari Gate Rd, Pahari Gate, Batala, Punjab 143505, India

reviews.text:
The historic Gurudwara Kandh Sahib is accessible from the very old Batala market. Until then, you can view the old haveli and various artifacts from that era.
Within a fort lay the whole city. Twelve gates marked its entrance and exit. The former names of these gates, including Sheranwala Gate, Khajuri Gate, Bhandari Gate, Ohri Gate, Thathiari Gate, Hathi Gate, Pahari Gate, Mori Gate, Kapuri Gate, Achli Gate, and so forth, are still in use. Even though their condition needs care, some of them are still living.
It was one of the entry gate to enter old Batala city. It has lost its pristine beauty rather now there is not even sign of old gate.
Area of a Historical city. Guru Nanak Dev Ji Marriage place
Pahari Gate is a passing gate to old Batala City locality,such likely other gates

Earlier there is gate named Pahari gate
It was demolished in past time, only one of the wall is left
Now this place is called Pahari gate
